metadata.feature_description: Analytics for social events including attendance, engagement, and event popularity

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard opens with module tabs visible
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard opened showing Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki tabs

steps.action: Click on Events tab to view Social Events analytics
steps.actual: Social Events dashboard displayed with title 'Social Events' and Events tab underlined

steps.action: View Community Health section for event attendance metrics
steps.actual: Community Health section shows three event-specific metrics: 'Events older than 6 hours with no Views' (0%), 'Events older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction' (0%), 'Events older than 24 hours with no attendees' (0%)

steps.action: View Engagement section in Social Events dashboard
steps.expected: Engagement chart and metrics are displayed
steps.actual: Engagement section shows weekly chart (MON-SUN), Engagement percentage (0%), Interacted count (0), Formed Relationship count (0), Shared count (0)

steps.action: View Trending Tags and Popular Content sections
steps.expected: Trending Tags and Popular Content sections display event data or empty state message
steps.actual: Both sections displayed correctly with messages 'No trending tags available in selected period' and 'No popular content available in selected period' (expected as there are no events in the system)

steps.action: Click on date range picker showing '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026'
steps.expected: Date range dropdown appears with period options
steps.actual: Dropdown appeared with options: Day, Week (selected), Month, Year, Custom

steps.action: Select 'Month' from the date range picker
steps.expected: Date range updates to show a one-month period
steps.actual: Date range changed to '9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' (one month period), Comparative Term automatically updated to '1 m'

steps.action: Change Comparative Term dropdown from '1 m' to '1 y'
steps.expected: Comparative Term updates to compare with 1 year ago
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown successfully changed to '1 y' (1 year), dashboard refreshed to show year-over-year comparison data

observations: The Social Events Module Analytics dashboard is fully functional and displays all expected sections: Community Health, Engagement, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content
Event-specific health metrics are displayed including: Events with no views, Events with views but no interaction, and Events with no attendees (attendance tracking)
The dashboard supports multiple date range options (Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom) with automatic comparative term adjustment
The Comparative Term dropdown allows selection between 1 week (1 w), 1 month (1 m), and 1 year (1 y) for period-over-period comparison
No event data was present in the test environment, so metrics showed 0% and empty states - this is expected behavior for a system without social events content
